page.title: 07The Crown Inn, Drayton.
page.content: The house I live in is about 300 years old.It was originally a farmhouse,but I do not know how long it has been a public house.It stands on an acre of land,part of which is a car park.Our living accommadation is a lounge,three bedrooms,bathroom and kitchen.The business has one very large bar which used to be two bars,a pool room and a skittle alley.Under the alley are three sheds and a garage_these used to be stables with living quarters above.My Dad buys the beer and spirits from the Bass depot at Chard.We sell farmhouse cider we get from Buckland St.Mary.We have seven skittle teams,three dart teams and two pool teams.These teams are important to us in the Winter when our income falls.
